Article.ArticleTitle: Room-temperature synthesized SnO<sub>2</sub> electron transport layers for efficient perovskite solar cells.

AbstractText: Tin oxide (SnO<sub>2</sub>) is widely used as electron transport layer (ETL) material in perovskite solar cells (PSCs). Numerous synthesis methods for SnO<sub>2</sub> have been reported, but they all require a proper thermal treatment for the SnO<sub>2</sub> ETLs. Herein we present a simple method to synthesize SnO<sub>2</sub> nanoparticles (NPs) at room temperature. By using butyl acetate as a precipitator and a proper UV-Ozone treatment to remove Cl residuals, excellent SnO<sub>2</sub> ETLs were obtained without any thermal annealing. The highest power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the prepared PSCs was 19.22% for reverse scan (RS) and 18.79% for forward scan (FS). Furthermore, flexible PSCs were fabricated with high PCEs of 15.27%/14.74% (RS/FS). The low energy consuming SnO<sub>2</sub> ETLs therefore show great promise for the flexible PSCs' commercialization.
